TitleBlock.Title: Power to amend schemes to reflect abolition of contracting-out

P1group.Title: Introduction

P1para.Text: This Schedule is about the power under section 24(2) to amend an occupational pension scheme in relation to some or all of its members.

P1group.Title: What can the power be used to do?

P2para.Text: The power may be used—

P3para.Text: to increase the employee contributions of the relevant members;
to alter the future accrual of benefits for or in respect of them.

P2para.Text: But the power may not be used in a way that would—

P3para.Text: increase the amount of the total annual employee contributions of the relevant members by more than the annual increase in the employer’s national insurance contributions in respect of them,

reduce the amount of the scheme’s liabilities in respect of the benefits that accrue annually for or in respect of the relevant members by more than the annual increase in the employer’s national insurance contributions in respect of them, or

result in the sum of the amount of any increase in the total annual employee contributions of the relevant members and the amount of any reduction in the scheme’s liabilities in respect of the benefits that accrue annually for or in respect of the relevant members being more than the annual increase in the employer’s national insurance contributions in respect of the relevant members.

P2para.Text: Regulations are to define what is meant by—

P3para.Text: the total annual employee contributions of the relevant members;
the annual increase in an employer’s national insurance contributions in respect of the relevant members;
a scheme’s liabilities in respect of the benefits that accrue annually for or in respect of the relevant members.

P2para.Text: Regulations may create exceptions to sub-paragraph (2).
The power may not be used in a way that would or might adversely affect the subsisting rights of—

P3para.Text: a member of the scheme, or
a survivor of a member of the scheme.

P2para.Text: “Subsisting right” and “survivor” have the meanings given by section 67A of the Pensions Act 1995.

P1para.Text: Regulations may impose further restrictions on the use of the power.

P1group.Title: Creation of exceptions

P1para.Text: The power may not be used to amend a scheme in relation to a member of a description specified in regulations under this paragraph.

P1group.Title: Requirement for actuary’s certificate

P2para.Text: The power may be used only if an actuary has certified that the proposed amendments would comply with such of the requirements imposed by or under this Schedule as are specified in regulations under this paragraph.
“Actuary” means—

P3para.Text: a person of a description specified in regulations, or
a person approved by the Secretary of State.

P1group.Title: When can the power be used?

P1para.Text: The power may be used before or after the repeal of section 41 of the Pension Schemes Act 1993 comes into force (but amendments made under it must not be framed so as to take effect before the repeal comes into force).

An amendment made before the repeal of section 41 of the Pension Schemes Act 1993 comes into force does not take effect in relation to any relevant members who have ceased to be in contracted-out employment by reference to the scheme before the repeal comes into force.

P1group.Title: Can the power be used more than once?

P2para.Text: The power may be used to amend a scheme in relation to the same relevant members on more than one occasion.

For the purposes of paragraph 2 as it applies in relation to the use of the power on the second or subsequent occasion, all of the amendments are to be treated as if they were being made on that occasion.

Regulations may make further provision modifying section 24(2) to (5) or this Schedule (including paragraph 2) where the power is used to amend the scheme in relation to the same relevant members on more than one occasion.

P1group.Title: Modifications for multi-employer or sectionalised schemes

P2para.Text: Regulations may modify section 24(2) to (5) or this Schedule as it applies in relation to—

P3para.Text: multi-employer schemes, or
schemes that have different rules for different members.

P2para.Text: “Multi-employer scheme” means a scheme in relation to which there is more than one employer.

P1group.Title: The power overrides other legislation

P1para.Text: An amendment under section 24 and this Schedule may be made in relation to any member, and has effect, despite anything in any other enactment to the contrary.

P1group.Title: Procedural requirements

P1para.Text: Regulations may impose procedural requirements about the use of the power and the manner in which any amendments must be made.

P1para.Text: In this Schedule—

Para.Text: “employee contributions” means, in relation to a member of a scheme, contributions made to the scheme by or on behalf of the member on his or her own account;
“relevant member”, in relation to a scheme, means a member in relation to whom the scheme has been or is to be amended under section 24(2).

TitleBlock.Title: Automatic transfer of pension benefits etc

P1group.Title: Regulations providing for transfer of cash equivalent of transferable benefits

P2para.Text: The Secretary of State must make regulations with a view to ensuring that, where a qualifying member of an automatic transfer scheme has transferable benefits under another pension scheme, the cash equivalent of the transferable benefits—

P3para.Text: is transferred to the automatic transfer scheme, and
is used to provide rights for the member under it.

P2para.Text: In this Schedule “automatic transfer scheme” means—

P3para.Text: a work-based pension scheme, other than a scheme of a prescribed description, which is registered under Chapter 2 of Part 4 of the Finance Act 2004 and is a money purchase scheme, or
a pension scheme of a prescribed description.

P2para.Text: In this Schedule “qualifying member”, in relation to an automatic transfer scheme, means an active member of the scheme of a prescribed description.
For the purposes of this Schedule a person has transferable benefits under a pension scheme if—

P3para.Text: the scheme is a transferable benefits scheme,
the person is a member of the scheme,
contributions to the scheme by, or on behalf or in respect of, the member have ceased,
the member has accrued rights to benefits under the applicable rules,
all of those rights accrued on or after the prescribed date (which may be a date before the coming into force of this paragraph),
the cash equivalent of those benefits is less than the prescribed amount (but not nil), and
any other prescribed conditions are met.

P2para.Text: In this Schedule “transferable benefits scheme” means—

P3para.Text: a work-based pension scheme, other than a scheme of a prescribed description, which is registered under Chapter 2 of Part 4 of the Finance Act 2004 and is a money purchase scheme, or
a pension scheme of a prescribed description.

P2para.Text: In sub-paragraph (4)—

Para.Text: “the applicable rules”—
in relation to an occupational pension scheme, has the meaning given by section 94(2) of the Pension Schemes Act 1993;
in relation to a personal pension scheme, means the rules of the scheme;
“benefits” means—
money purchase benefits other than money purchase benefits of a prescribed description, or
benefits of a prescribed description.

P1group.Title: Automatic transfer scheme to find out whether members have transferable benefits

P2para.Text: The regulations must require the trustees or managers of an automatic transfer scheme to take steps to find out whether a qualifying member of the scheme has transferable benefits under another pension scheme.
The regulations may make provision—

P3para.Text: about when a step is to be taken (for example, within a prescribed period after a person becomes a qualifying member or at prescribed intervals);
for the steps to be taken at any particular time to relate to a particular qualifying member, or to some or all qualifying members.

P1group.Title: Automatic transfer scheme to request transfer of cash equivalent

P2para.Text: The regulations must require the trustees or managers of an automatic transfer scheme to give a transfer notice if—

P3para.Text: they find out that a qualifying member of the scheme has transferable benefits under another pension scheme, and
any other prescribed conditions are met.

P2para.Text: A “transfer notice” is a notice given to the trustees or managers of the other pension scheme requesting the transfer of the cash equivalent of the transferable benefits to the automatic transfer scheme.

The conditions that may be prescribed because of sub-paragraph (1)(b) include a condition that the trustees or managers must not give a transfer notice unless the qualifying member consents in accordance with the regulations.

P1group.Title: Right to opt out of automatic transfer

P2para.Text: If the regulations do not include the condition mentioned in paragraph 3(3), they must ensure that where the duty to give a transfer notice has arisen in relation to transferable benefits of a qualifying member of an automatic transfer scheme, the member can opt out of the transfer in accordance with the regulations.
The regulations must provide that, where the member does opt out—

P3para.Text: the duty to give the transfer notice is not to be complied with, and
the cash equivalent of the member’s transferable benefits is not to be transferred.

P1group.Title: Information to be given to qualifying members of automatic transfer schemes

P2para.Text: The regulations must require a prescribed person to give information to a qualifying member of an automatic transfer scheme who has transferable benefits under another scheme for the purpose of helping the member to decide whether (as applicable)—

P3para.Text: to consent to the giving of a transfer notice in relation to the transferable benefits, or
to opt out of the transfer of the cash equivalent of the transferable benefits.

P2para.Text: The information to be given—

P3para.Text: must include information about the effect of the regulations, and in particular the member’s power to consent or right to opt out (as applicable);
may include other information, for example information about the schemes.

P1group.Title: Transferable benefits scheme to comply with request

P2para.Text: The regulations must require the trustees or managers of a pension scheme who receive a transfer notice requesting the transfer of the cash equivalent
of a person’s transferable benefits to do what is needed to carry out the request.
The regulations may in particular—

P3para.Text: require the trustees or managers of the scheme to take particular steps to carry out the request;
provide for the discharge, in prescribed circumstances, of any obligation to provide the transferable benefits.

P2para.Text: The regulations may provide for circumstances in which the duty to carry out the request does not apply.

P1group.Title: Automatic transfer scheme to use cash equivalent to provide rights under the scheme

P2para.Text: The regulations must require the trustees or managers of an automatic transfer scheme to whom the cash equivalent of a person’s transferable benefits is transferred to use the cash equivalent to provide rights for the person under the scheme.
The regulations may make provision about how that is to be done and in particular about—

P3para.Text: the nature and value of the rights to be provided;
calculating and verifying the value of the rights to be provided.

P1group.Title: Cash equivalents: calculation and verification

P2para.Text: The regulations may provide for the manner in which cash equivalents are to be calculated and verified.
The regulations may in particular—

P3para.Text: provide that a cash equivalent is to be increased or reduced in prescribed circumstances;
make provision about the time by reference to which a cash equivalent is to be calculated for the purposes of a provision of the regulations.

P2para.Text: Regulations made because of sub-paragraph (2)(a) may provide for a cash equivalent to be reduced to nil.

P1group.Title: Disclosure of information and establishment of database

P2para.Text: The regulations must make provision about disclosure of information.
The regulations may in particular require a person to disclose information to another person—

P3para.Text: for the purposes of helping a person to comply with a duty imposed on the person by the regulations, or
otherwise for the purposes of a provision of the regulations.

P2para.Text: The regulations may require the Secretary of State or the Regulator to establish and operate a database containing information relating to people who have or had transferable benefits for the purposes of helping the trustees or managers of an automatic transfer scheme to comply with their duties under the regulations.

P1group.Title: Compliance

P2para.Text: The regulations may make provision with a view to ensuring compliance with any provision of the regulations.
For this purpose the regulations may in particular—

P3para.Text: provide for the Regulator to issue a notice (a “compliance notice”) to a person with a view to ensuring the person’s compliance with a provision of the regulations;
provide for the Regulator to issue a notice (a “third party compliance notice”) to a person with a view to ensuring another person’s compliance with a provision of the regulations;

provide for the Regulator to issue a notice (a “penalty notice”) imposing a penalty on a person where the Regulator is of the opinion that the person has failed to comply with a compliance notice or third party compliance notice or has contravened a provision of the regulations;
provide for the making of a reference to the First-tier Tribunal or Upper Tribunal in respect of the issue of a penalty notice or the amount of a penalty;
confer other functions on the Regulator.

P2para.Text: The regulations may make provision for determining the amount, or the maximum amount, of a penalty in respect of a failure or contravention.
But the amount of a penalty imposed under the regulations in respect of a failure or contravention must not exceed—

P3para.Text: £5,000, in the case of an individual, and
£50,000, in any other case.

P1group.Title: Record keeping

P2para.Text: The regulations may require any person—

P3para.Text: to make records;
to preserve records for a prescribed period;
to provide records to the Regulator on request.

P2para.Text: The regulations may provide that section 10 of the Pensions Act 1995 (civil penalties) applies to a person who fails to comply with those requirements.

P1group.Title: Automatic transfer schemes: quality requirements and administration charges

P2para.Text: The regulations may impose requirements that must be satisfied by any automatic transfer scheme.
The requirements may in particular relate to—

P3para.Text: the governance of the scheme;
the administration of the scheme.

P2para.Text: The regulations may make provision limiting or prohibiting any administration charge that may otherwise be imposed on a member of an automatic transfer scheme.
Regulations made because of sub-paragraph (3)—

P3para.Text: may make provision for the manner of, and criteria for, determining whether an administration charge exceeds any limit or is prohibited;
may provide for the determination to be made in accordance with guidance issued from time to time by the Secretary of State.

P2para.Text: The requirements that may be imposed, and the charges that may be limited or prohibited, because of this paragraph need not relate to things done under the regulations.

P1group.Title: Transferable benefits schemes: administration charges

P2para.Text: The regulations may make provision limiting or prohibiting a relevant administration charge that may otherwise be imposed on a member of a transferable benefits scheme.
For this purpose an administration charge is “relevant” to the extent that it is imposed in respect of, or in connection with, anything done in compliance with a provision of the regulations.

P1group.Title: Further provision about the regulations

P1para.Text: The regulations may—

P3para.Text: impose or confer other functions on the trustees or managers of an automatic transfer scheme or transferable benefits scheme;
confer a discretion on a person.

P1group.Title: Review of limit on value of cash equivalent

P2para.Text: The regulations must require the Secretary of State to review from time to time the amount for the time being prescribed under paragraph 1(4)(f).
The regulations must provide—

P3para.Text: for the first review to be conducted no later than 5 years after the date on which regulations under this Schedule first come into force;
for subsequent reviews to be conducted no later than 5 years after the previous review.

P2para.Text: The regulations must require the Secretary of State, in conducting a review, to have regard to—

P3para.Text: changes in the general level of prices in Great Britain;
changes in the general level of earnings in Great Britain;
any other factors the Secretary of State considers relevant.

P2para.Text: The regulations must authorise the Secretary of State to estimate the general level of prices or earnings for the purposes of the review in the manner the Secretary of State thinks fit.
The Secretary of State may by regulations make provision for the purposes of requiring dormant pension accounts of a qualifying member of an
automatic transfer scheme to be merged into a current pension account of the member.
The regulations may not require a dormant pension account to be merged unless the accrued rights to benefits to which the account relates would be transferable benefits of the member if—

P3para.Text: all other accrued rights to benefits of the member, and any relevant contributions, were ignored, and
any other prescribed matter were ignored.

P2para.Text: The regulations may in particular—

P3para.Text: make provision for determining into which current pension account (if the member has more than one) a dormant pension account is to be merged;
provide that the rules of the scheme that are to apply to a merged pension account are those that apply to the current pension account into which a dormant pension account is being merged;
require the trustees or managers of the scheme to make a transfer of assets representing the accrued rights to benefits to which a dormant pension account relates;
include provision corresponding or similar to any provision which may be made by regulations under Part 1 of this Schedule.

P2para.Text: In this paragraph “pension account”, in relation to a member of a scheme, means an account relating to the member’s accrued rights to benefits in respect of a particular period of employment; and a pension account—

P3para.Text: is “dormant” if relevant contributions in relation to the period of employment to which the account relates have ceased; and
is “current” if such contributions have not ceased.

P2para.Text: In this paragraph—

P3para.Text: references to “accrued rights to benefits”, in relation to a member of a scheme, are to accrued rights to benefits under the applicable rules (within the meaning given by paragraph 1(6));
“employment” has the prescribed meaning;
“relevant contributions”, in relation to a member of a scheme, means contributions to the scheme by, or on behalf or in respect of, the member.

P1group.Title: Interpretation etc

P2para.Text: In this Schedule—

Para.Text: “active member”—
in relation to an occupational pension scheme, has the meaning given by section 124(1) of the Pensions Act 1995, and
in relation to a personal pension scheme, means a member of the scheme in respect of whom contributions are being paid into the scheme;

“administration charges”, in relation to a member of a pension scheme, means any of the following to the extent that they may be used to meet the administrative expenses of the scheme, to pay commission or in any other way that does not result in the provision of pension benefits for or in respect of members—
any payments made to the scheme by, or on behalf or in respect of, the member,
any income or capital gain arising from the investment of such payments, or
the value of the member’s rights under the scheme;
“automatic transfer scheme” has the meaning given by paragraph 1(2);
“managers”, in relation to a pension scheme (other than a scheme established under a trust), means the persons responsible for the management of the scheme;
“member”, in relation to a pension scheme, does not include a person who has become entitled under the scheme to the present payment of pension or other benefits;
“money purchase benefits” has the meaning given by section 181(1) of the Pension Schemes Act 1993;
“money purchase scheme” has the meaning given by section 181(1) of the Pension Schemes Act 1993;
“occupational pension scheme” has the meaning given by section 1 of the Pension Schemes Act 1993;
“pension scheme” means—
an occupational pension scheme, or
a personal pension scheme;
“personal pension scheme” has the meaning given by section 1 of the Pension Schemes Act 1993;
“prescribed” means prescribed by regulations made by the Secretary of State;
“qualifying member” has the meaning given by paragraph 1(3);
“the Regulator” means the Pensions Regulator;
“transferable benefits”, and references to a person having transferable benefits, are to be read in accordance with paragraph 1(4);
“transferable benefits scheme” has the meaning given by paragraph 1(5);
“transfer notice” means a notice given under regulations made because of paragraph 3;
“work-based pension scheme” means—
an occupational pension scheme,

a personal pension scheme where direct payment arrangements (within the meaning of section 111A of the Pension Schemes Act 1993) exist in respect of one or more members of the scheme who are workers, or
a personal pension scheme which is or has been registered under section 2 of the Welfare Reform and Pensions Act 1999 (stakeholder pension schemes);
“worker” means a person—
who is a worker for the purposes of Part 1 of the Pensions Act 2008, or
to whom a provision of Part 1 of that Act applies as if the person were a worker because of a provision of Chapter 8 of that Part;
but for the purposes of paragraph (b), ignore section 92 of that Act.

P2para.Text: The Secretary of State may by regulations make provision about when contributions to a pension scheme are to be regarded as having ceased for the purposes of paragraph 1(4)(c) or 16(4).

P1group.Title: Crown application

P2para.Text: This Schedule applies to a pension scheme managed by or on behalf of the Crown as it applies to other pension schemes.

Accordingly, references in this Schedule to a person in the person’s capacity as a trustee or manager of a pension scheme include the Crown, or a person acting on behalf of the Crown, in that capacity.
This Schedule applies to persons employed by or under the Crown as it applies to persons employed by a private person.

P1group.Title: Overriding provision

P2para.Text: Regulations under this Schedule may provide that specified provisions override any provision of an automatic transfer scheme or transferable benefits scheme to the extent that it conflicts with them.
A “specified provision” is a provision of regulations under this Schedule specified in the regulations for the purposes of this paragraph.

P1group.Title: Other provision relating to regulations under this Schedule

P2para.Text: Regulations under this Schedule may amend or otherwise modify any enactment (whenever passed or made).

Regulations made because of sub-paragraph (1) may in particular amend section 175(1) of the Pension Schemes Act 1993 (levies towards certain expenditure) so as to include expenditure of the Secretary of State under the regulations.
In this paragraph “enactment” includes an enactment contained in subordinate legislation within the meaning of the Interpretation Act 1978.

P1para.Text: Before making any regulations under this Schedule, the Secretary of State must consult such persons as the Secretary of State considers appropriate.
